title: London on par with Ibiza as the hottest day of the year arrives
text:
The heat is here! (Picture: Dan Kitwood/Getty Images) If you’re yet to leave the house – Stop.
Turn around and swap that winter coat for something else, because good weather is on the way.
Offensive petition calls on Madeleine McCann's parents to take lie detector test Yes, today is set to be the hottest day of the year so far – and it comes just days after we marked the official start of spring.
The day is set to be mostly dry with bright or sunny spells, reaching temperatures of up to 22C in London and southeast England.
Oh, and we’re set to be on par – temperature-wise – with Ibiza and Majorca.

Despite possibly being a little breezy over coasts and hills… it is going to feel warm, forecasters have revealed. How exciting.
The highest points of today’s good weather is expected to arrive at around 1pm… so it’s perfect for a lunch break in the park.

Sadly, for those in the northern and western parts of the UK, it looks to be a mild, cloudy start with outbreaks of rain.
Eastern Scotland, however, is predicted to be ‘very warm’ later.
Did somebody say BBQ?
The warm weather in London may even last beyond today – with sunshine predicted on Friday and Sunday too.
get the sunglasses ready (Picture: Oli Scarff/Getty Images) Speaking to Metro.co.uk , Met Office forecaster Craig Snell said: ‘Today we’re looking to be on par with Ibiza and Majorca in Spain.
‘The warmth will be mainly restricted to the southern third of the UK, who will see the best if the sunshine today.
Schoolgirl, 12, died after inhaling fumes from deodorant she sprayed on herself ‘The in the northern and western parts will be faced with a cloudy day with outbreaks of rain.
‘The south should really see the sunshine respond today, with highs peaking at between 21 and 22C.
‘It will be the warmest day of the year so far if we beat 20.1C, which we are fairly confident we will.
‘If we go over 21C, it will be the warmest March day recorded in the last five years.’
